verses.text: And now, O ye priests, this commandment \add is\add* for you.

If ye will not hear, and if ye will not lay \add it\add* to heart, To give glory unto my name, saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts, I will even send a curse upon you, and will curse your blessings: Yea, I have cursed them already, because ye do not lay \add it\add* to heart.
Behold, I \add will\add* corrupt your seed, And spread dung upon your faces, \add even\add* the dung of your solemn feasts; And \add one\add* shall take you away with it.
And ye shall know that I have sent this commandment unto you, That my covenant might be with Levi, saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts.
My covenant was with him of life and peace; And I gave them to him \add for\add* the fear wherewith he feared me, And was afraid before my name.
The law of truth was in his mouth, And iniquity was not found in his lips: He walked with me in peace and equity, And did turn many away from iniquity.
For the priestâ€™s lips should keep knowledge, And they should seek the law at his mouth: For he \add is\add* the messenger of the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts.
But ye are departed out of the way; Ye have caused many to stumble at the law; Ye have corrupted the covenant of Levi, saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts.
Therefore have I also made you contemptible and base before all the people, According as ye have not kept my ways, But have been partial in the law.
Have we not all one father? Hath not one God created us? Why do we deal treacherously every man against his brother, By profaning the covenant of our fathers?

Judah hath dealt treacherously, And an abomination is committed in Israel and in Jerusalem; For Judah hath profaned the holiness of the \sc Lord\sc* which he loved, And hath married the daughter of a strange god.
The \sc Lord\sc* will cut off the man that doth this, the master and the scholar, Out of the tabernacles of Jacob, And him that offereth an offering unto the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts.

And this have ye done again, Covering the altar of the \sc Lord\sc* \add with\add* tears, \add with\add* weeping, and \add with\add* crying out, Insomuch that \add he\add* regardeth not the offering any more, Or receiveth \add it with\add* good will at your hand.

Yet ye say, Wherefore? Because the \sc Lord\sc* hath been witness between thee and the wife of thy youth, Against whom thou hast dealt treacherously: Yet \add is\add* she thy companion, and the wife of thy covenant.

And did not he make one? Yet had he the residue of the spirit. And wherefore one? That he might seek a godly seed. Therefore take heed to your spirit, And let none deal treacherously against the wife of his youth.

\add For\add* the \sc Lord\sc*, the God of Israel, saith that he hateth putting away: For \add one\add* covereth violence with his garment, saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts: Therefore take heed to your spirit, that ye deal not treacherously.

Ye have wearied the \sc Lord\sc* with your words. Yet ye say, Wherein have we wearied \add him\add*? When ye say, Every one that doeth evil \add is\add* good in the sight of the \sc Lord\sc*, And he delighteth in them; Or, Where \add is\add* the God of judgment?
